Detailed Description

Supports RTP and RTCP with Symmetric RTP support for NAT traversal.

RTP is defined in RFC 3550.

Definition in file rtp.h.

enum ast_rtp_get_result
 

Enumerator:
AST_RTP_GET_FAILED  Failed to find the RTP structure
AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL  RTP structure exists but true native bridge can not occur so try partial
AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE  RTP structure exists and native bridge can occur

03385    if (!(pr1 = get_proto(c1))) {
03386       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't find native functions for channel '%s'\n", c1->name);
03387       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03388       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03389       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03390    }
03391 
03392    /* Get channel specific interface structures */
03393    pvt0 = c0->tech_pvt;
03394    pvt1 = c1->tech_pvt;
03395 
03396    /* Get audio and video interface (if native bridge is possible) */
03397    audio_p0_res = pr0->get_rtp_info(c0, &p0);
03398    video_p0_res = pr0->get_vrtp_info ? pr0->get_vrtp_info(c0, &vp0) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03399    text_p0_res = pr0->get_trtp_info ? pr0->get_trtp_info(c0, &vp0) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03400    audio_p1_res = pr1->get_rtp_info(c1, &p1);
03401    video_p1_res = pr1->get_vrtp_info ? pr1->get_vrtp_info(c1, &vp1) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03402    text_p1_res = pr1->get_trtp_info ? pr1->get_trtp_info(c1, &vp1) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03403 
03404    /* If we are carrying video, and both sides are not reinviting... then fail the native bridge */
03405    if (video_p0_res != AST_RTP_GET_FAILED && (audio_p0_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || video_p0_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE))
03406       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03407    if (video_p1_res != AST_RTP_GET_FAILED && (audio_p1_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || video_p1_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE))
03408       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03409 
03410    /* Check if a bridge is possible (partial/native) */
03411    if (audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_GET_FAILED || audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_GET_FAILED) {
03412       /* Somebody doesn't want to play... */
03413       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03414       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03415       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03416    }
03417 
03418    /* If we need to feed DTMF frames into the core then only do a partial native bridge */
03419    if (ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_0)) {
03420       ast_set_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF);
03421       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03422    }
03423 
03424    if (ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_1)) {
03425       ast_set_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF);
03426       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03427    }
03428 
03429    /* If both sides are not using the same method of DTMF transmission 
03430     * (ie: one is RFC2833, other is INFO... then we can not do direct media. 
03431     * --------------------------------------------------
03432     * | DTMF Mode |  HAS_DTMF  |  Accepts Begin Frames |
03433     * |-----------|------------|-----------------------|
03434     * | Inband    | False      | True                  |
03435     * | RFC2833   | True       | True                  |
03436     * | SIP INFO  | False      | False                 |
03437     * --------------------------------------------------
03438     * However, if DTMF from both channels is being monitored by the core, then
03439     * we can still do packet-to-packet bridging, because passing through the 
03440     * core will handle DTMF mode translation.
03441     */
03442    if ( (ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) != ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_HAS_DTMF)) ||
03443        (!c0->tech->send_digit_begin != !c1->tech->send_digit_begin)) {
03444       if (!ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) || !ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF)) {
03445          ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03446          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03447          return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03448       }
03449       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03450       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03451    }
03452 
03453    /* If the core will need to compensate and the P2P bridge will need to feed up DTMF frames then we can not reliably do so yet, so do not P2P bridge */
03454    if ((audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL && ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) && ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE)) ||
03455        (audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL && ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) && ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE))) {
03456       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03457       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03458       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03459    }
03460 
03461    /* Get codecs from both sides */
03462    codec0 = pr0->get_codec ? pr0->get_codec(c0) : 0;
03463    codec1 = pr1->get_codec ? pr1->get_codec(c1) : 0;
03464    if (codec0 && codec1 && !(codec0 & codec1)) {
03465       /* Hey, we can't do native bridging if both parties speak different codecs */
03466       if (option_debug > 2)
03467          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel codec0 = %d is not codec1 = %d, cannot native bridge in RTP.\n", codec0, codec1);
03468       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03469       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03470       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03471    }
03472 
03473    /* If either side can only do a partial bridge, then don't try for a true native bridge */
03474    if (audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL || audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL) {
03475       /* In order to do Packet2Packet bridging both sides must be in the same rawread/rawwrite */
03476       if (c0->rawreadformat != c1->rawwriteformat || c1->rawreadformat != c0->rawwriteformat) {
03477          if (option_debug)
03478             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Cannot packet2packet bridge - raw formats are incompatible\n");
03479          ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03480          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03481          return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03482       }
03483       if (option_verbose > 2)
03484          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Packet2Packet bridging %s and %s\n", c0->name, c1->name);
03485       res = bridge_p2p_loop(c0, c1, p0, p1, timeoutms, flags, fo, rc, pvt0, pvt1);
03486    } else {
03487       if (option_verbose > 2) 
03488          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Native bridging %s and %s\n", c0->name, c1->name);
03489       res = bridge_native_loop(c0, c1, p0, p1, vp0, vp1, tp0, tp1, pr0, pr1, codec0, codec1, timeoutms, flags, fo, rc, pvt0, pvt1);
03490    }
03491 
03492    return res;
03493 }

01608       if (c1)

01614    else

01617       destcodec = destpr->get_codec(c0);
01618    else
01619       destcodec = 0;
01620    /* Ensure we have at least one matching codec */
01621    if (!(srccodec & destcodec)) {
01622       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01623       if (c1)
01624          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01625       return 0;
01626    }
01627    /* Consider empty media as non-existant */
01628    if (audio_src_res == AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE && !srcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)
01629       srcp = NULL;
01630    if (srcp && (srcp->nat || ast_test_flag(srcp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))
01631       nat_active = 1;
01632    /* Bridge media early */
01633    if (destpr->set_rtp_peer(c0, srcp, vsrcp, tsrcp, srccodec, nat_active))
01634       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to setup early bridge to '%s'\n", c0->name, c1 ? c1->name : "<unspecified>");

01636    if (c1)
01637       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01638    if (option_debug)
01639       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Setting early bridge SDP of '%s' with that of '%s'\n", c0->name, c1 ? c1->name : "<unspecified>");
